description: [CAUSE] A tmnxRpkiNotifySession notification is generated when a rpki
session either comes up or goes down. Possible reasons for this to
happen is listed below:
(a) a session goes down due to hold-timer expiry.
(b) a session goes down due to failure of the TCP connection.
(c) a session goes down due to session ID mismatch.
(d) a session goes down due to sent or received Error Report PDU
containing fatal error code
(e) a session comes up (established state)
[EFFECT] This may remove the routes learned from a particular
rpki server if session goes down. Or start learning routes
from a rpki session which was newly established.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.

Summary.eval: ($v4==1) ? 'RPKI session is up' : 'RPKI session is down due to $v3'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiNotifySession TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddrType i 0 TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddr s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiErrorType i 1 TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiTrapStatus i 1

description: The value of tmnxRpkiPeerAddrType indicates the type of address for the
BGP peer represented by tmnxRpkiPeerAddr.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddrType

description: The value of tmnxRpkiPeerAddr indicates the address for the Rpki peer.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddr

description: The value of tmnxRpkiErrorType indicates the type of the error
message seen on the Rpki session.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiErrorType

description: The value of tmnxRpkiTrapStatus indicates the state of the trap.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiTrapStatus

description: [CAUSE] This notification is generated when a stale timer expires. The
stale timer expires due to the following reasons:
1) The peer goes down, and never comes up within the stale timer
interval
2) Peer goes down and comes backup and refreshes the databases. The
stale timer is expired to remove unrefreshed entries in the database.
3) The peer goes down and comes back again and again goes down before
refreshing any entries. Here again the stale timer is expired due to
unstable connection.
[EFFECT] This may remove the routes learned from a particular
rpki server if session goes down. Or start learning routes
from a rpki session which was newly established.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
The value of tmnxRpkiPeerAddrType indicates the type of address for the
BGP peer represented by tmnxRpkiPeerAddr.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddrType

description: The value of tmnxRpkiPeerAddr indicates the address for the Rpki peer.
variables.name: TIMETRA-RPKI-MIB::tmnxRpkiPeerAddr
